org.stekikun.dolmen.syntax

Class Extent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.stekikun.dolmen.syntax.CExtent
      • org.stekikun.dolmen.syntax.Extent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PExtent

    public class Extent
extends CExtent
    Instances of this class describe ranges of characters in files, and are used to link parsed entities with their concrete representation in the original sources.

    They represent a degenerate form of composite extents where no placeholder replacement is required and the extent stands for the contents of a simple character region of a file.

    Author:
    St√©phane Lescuyer

      The line where the extent starts (1-based)

      The starting character offset of the extent (0-based)

      • realLength

        public int realLength()
        Description copied from class: CExtent
        The real length of an extent is the actual length of its representation once all place-holders have been replaced.

        It can be different from CExtent.length(), the length of the extent as it appeared uninstantiated in the original source.

        Specified by:
        realLength in class CExtent
        Returns:
        the real length of this extent
        See Also:
        CExtent.find()

      • findOrigin

        public SourceMapping.Origin findOrigin(int offset,
                                       int length)
        Description copied from class: CExtent
        Finding the origin in a composite extent amounts to finding the innermost extent, composite or not, whose instantiation covers the given region.
        Specified by:
        findOrigin in class CExtent
        Parameters:
        offset - relative offset from the start of this extent
        Returns:
        the origin of the region described by the relative offset and length
        See Also:
        SourceMapping.Origin
